enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.help: Will disable if an error occurs; otherwise set to disable to disable plugin

channel-update_timeout.label: Channel Update Timeout
channel-update_timeout.help: Default pulls channel data from provider in hours

channel-import_groups.label: Import Channel Groups
channel-import_groups.help: Imports groups from provider into the group other column

player-tuner_count.label: tuner_count
player-tuner_count.help: Number of streams active at one time

player-stream_type.label: stream_type
player-stream_type.help: M3U8 send m3u8 file directly to client.  ffmpeg uses ffmpeg for m3u8 urls. streamlink uses the python module streamlink. internal uses internally coded modules.

player-enable_url_filter.label: Enable URL Filtering
player-enable_url_filter.help: Only works with internalproxy. Filters out streams from URL addresses based on regular expression

player-url_filter.label: URL Filter
player-url_filter.help: Only used with stream_type=internalproxy.  Based on the URL uses standard regular expressions

player-enable_pts_filter.label: Enable PTS Filtering
player-enable_pts_filter.help: Works with internalproxy and ffmpegproxy. Filters out corrupted PTS packets.  Requires ffprobe.exe

player-pts_minimum.label: pts_minimum
player-pts_minimum.help: Default 10,000,000 or 108 seconds after midnight. Filters out non-standard streams that whose PTS starts at midnight.

player-pts_max_delta.label: pts_max_delta
player-pts_max_delta.help: Default 3,000,000 or 32 seconds. when playing contiguous blocks of video, filters out any blocks that do not have a continuous PTS counter.

player-enable_pts_resync.label: Enable PTS/DTS Resync
player-enable_pts_resync.help: Works with internalproxy and ffmpegproxy. Corrects timing issues with the video and audio streams and makes them contiguous

player-pts_resync_type.label: PTS/DTS Resync Type
player-pts_resync_type.help: Uses either ffmpeg genpts or internal resequencing

epg-min_refresh_rate.label: EPG Min Refresh Rate
epg-min_refresh_rate.help: Default=21600 seconds (6 hours). When a HTTP request for epg data is received, will refresh the data if older than this value.
